English:
Hmm... Quite the adventure! A labyrinth,
some disappearances, and a giant Digimon to boot.
Chinese:
呵呵……失蹤事件加上迷途之村，還有巨型數碼寶貝跟侵食者……
聽起來是場浩大的冒險。
Korean:
흐음… 실종 사건에 마요이가, 거대 디지몬에 이터…
꽤나 대모험이었던 모양이군
German:
Hm ... Ein ganz schönes Abenteuer! Ein Labyrinth,
vermisste Leute und obendrein noch ein
riesiges Digimon.

English:
It's that giant Digimon that warrants the most
attention, though.
Chinese: 值得注意的是那隻巨型數碼寶貝。
German:
Das Riesen-Digimon ist allerdings das
Bemerkenswerteste an der Sache.

English:
Let's think back on that man who was being
controlled by that one Digimon.
Chinese: 你還記得之前那個被數碼寶貝操控的男人吧？
German:
Erinnern wir uns an den Mann, der von diesem einen
Digimon gesteuert wurde.

English:
That Digimon had influence over him, but this
girl seems to have had the influence over the
Digimon.
Chinese:
他是受到了數碼寶貝的影響，
相反的，那位女性則是影響了數碼寶貝。
Korean:
그는 디지몬에게 영향을 받아 버렸지만―
반대로 그녀는, 디지몬에게 영향을 끼친 거겠지
German:
Das Digimon hat ihn beherrscht, aber hier scheint
das Mädchen das Digimon beherrscht zu haben.

English:
Her deep-seated delusions, her desperate need
for approval...
Chinese: 她心底潛藏著「執迷」、「缺乏認同感」、「利己主義」。
German:
Ihre tiefgreifenden Wahnvorstellungen und ihr
verzweifeltes Bedürfnis nach Anerkennung ...

English:
The workings of her mind called a Digimon to
her, and she wound up in complete control over it.
Chinese:
這些精神上的作用吸引了數碼寶貝，並與之結合，
甚至完全支配了數碼寶貝。
Korean:
그런 정신 작용이 디지몬을 불러들였고, 이어진 결과
완전히 지배해 버렸다
German:
Was in ihrem Kopf vorging, hat ein Digimon
angelockt, das sie letztendlich völlig unter ihrer
Kontrolle hatte.

English:
The bond between them then grew stronger when the
labyrinth appeared, to a supernatural degree.
Chinese:
然後因為迷途之村的出現，使得他們的連結更緊密，
發揮了超乎想像的能力……
Korean:
그리고, 마요이가의 발생으로 서로의 연결이 강해져서
초현실적인 힘을 발휘하기에 이르렀다…
German:
Die Verbindung zwischen den beiden wurde stärker,
als das Labyrinth erschienen ist. Sogar
in übernatürlichem Maße.

English:
She was no hacker, though. She was just an
ordinary person, only weakly connected to Digimon.
Chinese:
她並不是駭客，
只是跟數碼寶貝完全無關的普通人。
Korean:
그녀는 해커가 아니야
디지몬과도 연이 먼, 극히 일반적인 인간이다
German:
Sie war allerdings kein Hacker. Nur ein normaler
Mensch mit einer schwachen Verbindung zu Digimon.

English:
Regardless, this incident occurred as a result
of the fact that the Digimon was enhanced.
Chinese:
可是卻能強化數碼寶貝，並加以操控，
還引起這次的事件。
Korean:
그렇지만, 디지몬을 강화한데다가 사역하여
이번 사건을 일으켰다
German:
Dieser Vorfall ergab sich aus der Tatsache, dass
das Digimon verstärkt war.

English:
There are phenomenal powers hidden away within
the realm of human consciousness.
Chinese: 人類的意志真的是……隱藏了很多不可思議的力量……
Korean: 인간의 의식이라는 건, 이렇게나 무시무시한 힘을 갖고 있지…
German: Der menschliche Geist birgt enorme Kräfte.

English:
Anyway, congratulations on resolving the case.
Thanks for all your hard work.
Chinese:
總之，恭喜你順利解決這次的事件，
辛苦了。
Korean:
어쨌든, 사건의 해결은 축하할 일이다
수고 많았다
German:
Wie dem auch sei, Glückwunsch jedenfalls,
dass du den Fall gelöst hast.
Danke für deine harte Arbeit.

English:
You are not only blessed with good luck, but also
continue to exhibit great skill.
Chinese: 你果然不只運氣好，還兼具實力呢！
Korean:
넌, 운 뿐만 아니라―
실력도 착실히 갖추어 가고 있어
German:
Du hast nicht nur Glück, sondern erweist dich
auch weiterhin als tüchtig.

English: I couldn't ask for anything more.

I am concerned about Akemi Suedou's activities,
however.
Chinese: 不過最叫人在意的，還是末堂明實的動靜——
Korean: 하지만, 신경 쓰이는 건 스에도 아케미의 동향―
German:
Akemi Suedous Aktivitäten machen mir jedoch
Sorgen.

English:
Why was a man of his caliber alone inside the 
labyrinth despite all the dangers he would face?
Chinese:
像他那種人材，明明知道異空間內部很危險，
為什麼還在裡頭單獨行動？
Korean:
마요이가 내부는 위험한데도 불구하고
어째서, 그 정도 되는 인재가 단독으로 움직이고 있지?
German:
Warum war jemand von seinem Kaliber denn allein
im Labyrinth, obwohl es so gefährlich ist?

English:
Maybe ordinary people like us can't fathom the
behavior of geniuses?
Chinese: 難道這就是所謂的“凡人無法理解天才的行為”嗎？
Korean: 천재라 불리는 인물의 행동을, 평범한 사람은 헤아릴 수 없다는 건가?
German:
Vielleicht können normale Leute wie wir das
Verhalten von Genies nicht nachvollziehen?

English:
Rather, that is to say, their motives are beyond
our understanding.
Chinese:
但這也表示，
他的行動背後有我們“無法理解的動機”……
Korean:
하지만― 그건, 바꿔 말하면
우리들은 "헤아릴 수 없는 동기"가 있다고도 할 수 있지
German:
Soll heißen, dass ihre Beweggründe sich unserem
Verständnis entziehen.

English:
Inferences become conjecture, leaving the actual
facts behind, I suppose.
Chinese: 越推理，越是流於臆測，越是飛躍性的思考，越容易遠離事實嗎？
Korean: …추리가 억측을 부르고, 비약이 진실을 놓치게 만든다, 인가
German:
Schlussfolgerungen werden zu Spekulationen und
die eigentlichen Fakten bleiben auf der Strecke.

English:
I might be thinking too hard about this, getting
lost in my own labyrinth of thoughts and 
emotions.
Chinese: 搞不好，我也是一樣……誤入了思考與無上幸福的迷途之村裡。
Korean:
나도 헤매고 있는 걸지도 모르겠군…
사고와 감정의 마요이가에서
German:
Vielleicht zerbreche ich mir auch zu sehr den
Kopf und verirre mich in meinem eigenen
mentalen Labyrinth.
